title: Country Garden rebrands to Risland and lists Cawdor site
text:
"In terms of the way we do business and who we partner with, nothing will change except our brand."

"We will continue to focus on progressing our current suite of projects with our valued partners while always looking for future opportunities."

The first order of the day for the newly named group is the sale of its Cawdor landholding, in a small village 60 kilometres southwest of the Sydney CBD, quietly acquired for over $80 million in 2017.

It is understood the developer paid "too much" for the site at 690-900 Cawdor Road, which was a long way from a residential rezoning.

At about the same time, it paid $400 million for a 363-hectare site in Melbourne's Wyndham Vale now poised for its "Windamere" housing project.

The purchase of the Cawdor site along with other housing land it was looking at in Wilton, close to Cawdor, surfaced last year when it was inadvertantly drawn into the ICAC inquiry into corruption at Canterbury Council.

Country Garden has appointed Colliers International's Matthew Meynell and JLL's John Marcee to market the expressions of interest sale of the Cawdor landholding.

The company has not offered a price guide but sources said it was unlikely that Risland would recover the full amount it paid.

Risland burst onto the Australian development scene in 2014 after it scooped up a site in Sydney's north for its 830-unit Ryde Garden apartment project. The completed project is next to the new North Ryde metro station.
description: The group has been undertaking a review of its international development and site-buying strategies in the past year.
